name: N'-[(2E)-4,6-diphenyl-2H-thiopyran-2-ylidene]-N,N-dimethylbenzene-1,4-diamine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2787
Reason: The compound N'-[(2E)-4,6-diphenyl-2H-thiopyran-2-ylidene]-N,N-dimethylbenzene-1,4-diamine has a structure composed of a benzene ring with two phenyl groups attached through a thiopyran ring, a dimethyl group, and a diamine group. The presence of the thiopyran ring and the two phenyl groups contribute to the melting point due to their increased molecular weight and potential for intermolecular interactions. The diamine group can also contribute to the melting point due to its increased molecular weight and potential for hydrogen bonding. The presence of the methyl group can also contribute to the melting point due to its increased molecular weight and potential for intermolecular interactions.
